gurmukhi: ਕਿਧੌ ਸੁਵਰਨ ਕੀ ਚਿਤ੍ਰ ਕੀ ਪੁੱਤ੍ਰਕਾ ਹੈ || ਕਿਧੌ ਕਾਮ ਕੀ ਕਾਮਨੀ ਕੀ ਪ੍ਰਭਾ ਹੈ ||੧੧੪||
transliteration: Kidhau Suvaran Kichitra Kipouttrakaadhai|| Kidhau Kaam Kikaamanndkiprabhaa Hai||114||
translation: She looked like a golden puppet or the glory of a beautiful lady, full of passion.114.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਧੌ ਚਿੱਤ੍ਰ ਕੀ ਪੁੱਤ੍ਰਕਾ ਸੀ ਬਨੀ ਹੈ || ਕਿਧੌ ਸੰਖਨੀ ਚਿੱਤ੍ਰਨੀ ਪਦਮਨੀ ਹੈ ||
transliteration: Kidhau Chittra Kipouttrkaa Sipouttrakaadhai|| Kidhau Sankhanichittranipadmanihai||
translation: She appeared like a puppet exquisite a Padmini (different gradations of a woman).

gurmukhi: ਕਿਧੌ ਰਾਗ ਪੂਰੇ ਭਰੀ ਰਾਗ ਮਾਲਾ || ਬਰੀ ਰਾਮ ਤੈਸੀ ਸੀਅਾ ਅਾਜ ਬਾਲਾ ||੧੧੫||
transliteration: Kidhau Raag Poore Bhariraag Maalaa|| Bariraam Taisiseeaa Aaj Baalaa||115||
translation: She looked like Ragmala, studded completely with Ragas (musical modes), and Ram wedded such a beautiful Sita.115.

gurmukhi: ਛਕੇ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਦੋਨੋ ਲਗੇ ਨੈਨ ਅੈਸੇ || ਮਨੋ ਫਾਧ ਫਾਂਧੈ ਮ੍ਰਿਗੀਰਾਜ ਜੈਸੇ ||
transliteration: Chhake Prem Dono Lage Nain Aise|| Mano Phaadh Phaandhai Mrigeeraaj Jaise||
translation: Having been absorbed in love for each other.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਧੁੰ ਬਾਕ ਬੈਣੀ ਕਟੰ ਦੇਸ ਛੀਣੰ || ਰੰਗੇ ਰੰਗ ਰਾਮੰ ਸੁਨੈਣੰ ਪ੍ਰਬੀਣੰ ||੧੧੬||
transliteration: Bidhoung Baak Bainikatan Des Chheenan|| Rane Ran Raamannd Sounainan||116||
translation: Sita of sweet speech and slim waist and visually absorbed with Ram, is looking exquisitely beautiful.116.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਣੀ ਰਾਮ ਸੀਤਾ ਸੁਣੀ ਸ੍ਰੳੁਣ ਰਾਮੰ || ਗਹੇ ਸਸਤ੍ਰ ਅਸਤ੍ਰੰ ਰਿਸਯੋ ਤੳੁਨ ਜਾਮੰ ||
transliteration: Jiniraam Seetaa Sounisraoun Raamannd|| Gade Sastra Astran Risyo Taoun Jaamannd||
translation: When Parashuram heard this that Ram hath conquered Sita, he at that time, in great ire, held up his arms and weapons.

gurmukhi: ਕਹਾ ਜਾਤ ਭਾਖਯੋ ਰਮੋ ਰਾਮ ਠਾਢੇ || ਲਖੋ ਅਾਜ ਕੈਸੇ ਭੲੇ ਬੀਰ ਗਾਢੇ ||੧੧੭||
transliteration: Kahaa Jaat Bhaakhyo Ramo Raam Thndhaa|| Lakho Aaj Kaise Bhae Bir Gaddhe||117||
translation: He asked Ram to stop there and challenged him saying.”I shall now see, what type of hero thou art.”177.
Bhakha Pingal Di (The language of prosody):

gurmukhi: ਭਟ ਹੁੰਕੇ ਧੁੰਕੇ ਬੰਕਾਰੇ || ਰਣ ਬੱਜੇ ਗੱਜੇ ਨੱਗਾਰੇ ||
transliteration: Bhat Hounke Dhounke Bankdare|| Ran Bajje Gadje Naggdare||
translation: The warriors raised loud shouts and the terrible trumpets resounded.

gurmukhi: ਰਣ ਹੁੱਲ ਕਲੋਲੰ ਹੁੱਲਾਲੰ || ਢਲ ਹੱਲੰ ਢੱਲੰ ੳੁੱਛਾਲੰ ||੧੧੮||
transliteration: Ran Hull Kaloan Hullaalan|| Dhal Hallan Dhallan Ouchcdhaalan||118||
translation: There were war-cries in the battlefield and the warriors, being pleased began to hurl their shields up and down.118.

gurmukhi: ਰਣ ੳੁੱਠੇ ਕੁੱਠੇ ਮੁੱਛਾਲੇ || ਸਰ ਛੁੱਟੇ ਜੁੱਟੇ ਭੀਹਾਲੇ ||
transliteration: Ran Outthe Koutthe Mouchcdhaale|| Sar Chhoutte Joutte Bhedhaale||
translation: The warriors with twined whiskers gathered together for war and fought with each other discharging dreadful shower of arrows.

gurmukhi: ਰਤੁ ਡਿੱਗੇ ਭਿੱਗੇ ਜੋਧਾਣੰ || ਕਣਣੰਛੇ ਕੱਛੇ ਕਿਕਾਣੰ ||੧੧੯||
transliteration: Rat(u) Digge Bhigge Jodhaanan|| Kan-nanchhe Kachchhe Kikaanan||119||
translation: The fighters drenched with blood began to fell and the horses were being crushed in the battlefield.119.

gurmukhi: ਭੀਖਣੀਯੰ ਭੇਰੀ ਭੁੰਕਾਰੰ || ਝਲ ਲੰਕੇ ਖੰਡੇ ਦੁੱਧਾਰੰ ||
transliteration: Bheekhaneeyan Bheribhounkaaran Jhal Lanke Khande Duddhaaran||
translation: The sound of the drums of Yoginis was being heard and the double-edged daggers glistened.
